attributes.name: DocsDemo
attributes.description:
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.

{{#docs-demo as |demo|}}
  {{#demo.example name='docs-demo-basic.hbs'}}
    <p>I am a <strong>handlebars</strong> template!</p>
    <p>The value is: {{val}}</p>
    <div>
      {{input value=val}}
    </div>
  {{/demo.example}}

  {{demo.snippet 'docs-demo-basic.hbs'}}
{{/docs-demo}}

attributes.name: DocsHero
attributes.description: A component that renders a hero banner. Useful for your docs site's homepage.

attributes.name: DocsKeyboardShortcuts
attributes.description: A component that enables keyboard shortcuts. Press '?' to toggle the keyboard shortcuts dialog.

attributes.name: DocsLink
attributes.description:
Just a styled subclass of LinkComponent. Comes in handy when rending links in Markdown templates:

Here I am, telling you about {{docs-link 'another page' 'docs.x-foo'}}

attributes.name: DocsLogo
attributes.description: A simple component to render an Ember, Ember CLI or Ember Data logo.

fields.name: logo
fields.description:
Render either the 'ember', 'ember-cli' or 'ember-data' logo:

{{docs-logo logo='ember'}}
{{docs-logo logo='ember-cli'}}
{{docs-logo logo='ember-data'}}

attributes.name: DocsNavbar
attributes.description: Render a header showing a link to your documentation, your project logo and a GitHub link to your addon's repository.

attributes.name: SampleComponent
attributes.description:
Pretty cool component, right?

To use it, you could enter the following in your template:

{{sample-component foo='bar'}}

methods.name: impressUser
methods.description: The best method ever made, anywhere.
